titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Ralph W.G. Wyckoff papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff FA1000

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-09-18 17:59:14 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ralph W.G. Wyckoff papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for scholarly research.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be restricted from scholarly research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be restricted from scholarly research at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/RAC Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of correspondence and reprints.

Correspondence from 1926 October including arrangements to start work at RIMR and consists mostly of correspondence and reports to administration on work plans and progress. Includes inventory of items sold to Lederle Lab on resignation. Several handwritten letters are included.
Also includes photograph and biography from Who's Who in America, 1972-1973.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ralph Walter Graystone Wyckoff Associate Member Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research (RIMR), 1927-1937.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Of particular note, a 1933 June letter advising of Executive Committee action for extraction of polonium and arrangements on transfer of radium to Memorial Hospital.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Of particular note is a reprint of Niels Bohr article on "Light and Life" and comments by Wyckoff.
